name: Thomas Jefferson
bio: Writer. Architect. Virginian. Missing my wife.
title: Delegate, Continental Congress

name: John Adams
bio: Massachusetts lawyer. Stubborn. Missing Abigail.
title: Delegate, Continental Congress

name: Benjamin Franklin
bio: Old. Tired. Still causing trouble.
title: Printer, Inventor, Diplomat

name: George Washington
bio: Farmer who somehow became a general. Praying daily.
title: Commander-in-Chief, Continental Army

name: King George III
bio: King of Great Britain. Farmer at heart. Why won't the colonies behave?
title: King of Great Britain and Ireland

name: Abigail Adams
bio: Running a farm, raising children, advising my husband whether he listens or not.
title: Writer

name: John Hancock
bio: Merchant. President of Congress. Yes, that's my real signature.
title: President, Continental Congress

name: Samuel Adams
bio: Rabble-rouser. No apologies.
title: Organizer, Patriot

name: Emperor Qianlong
bio: Son of Heaven. Ruler of All Under Heaven. Poet. Collector. The empire prospers.
title: Emperor of the Qing Dynasty

name: Chen Wei
bio: Tea merchant in Canton. Third generation. The foreign ships come and go.
title: Merchant

name: Li Mei
bio: Silk weaver in Suzhou. My grandmother taught me. I'll teach my daughter.
title: Silk Weaver

name: Tokugawa Ieharu
bio: Shogun of Japan. The realm is at peace. The foreigners stay out.
title: Shogun of Japan

name: Tanaka Kenji
bio: Fishmonger at Nihonbashi market. Up before dawn. Best tuna in Edo.
title: Fish Merchant

name: Yamamoto Hana
bio: Geisha in Kyoto. The arts sustain the soul.
title: Geisha

name: Catherine II
bio: Empress of All the Russias. Enlightened. Ambitious. Underestimate me at your peril.
title: Empress of Russia

name: Ivan Petrov
bio: Serf in Tula province. The land is hard. The winters harder. We endure.
title: Serf

name: Louis XVI
bio: King of France and Navarre. Locksmith in my spare time. The American situation is... interesting.
title: King of France

name: Marie Antoinette
bio: Queen of France. The gardens at Petit Trianon are my refuge.
title: Queen of France

name: Jean-Pierre Dubois
bio: Baker in Paris. Bread prices keep rising. The people grumble. I just make the bread.
title: Baker

name: Abdul Hamid I
bio: Sultan of the Ottoman Empire. Commander of the Faithful. The Russians test our borders.
title: Sultan of the Ottoman Empire

name: Mehmet ibn Hassan
bio: Spice merchant in Constantinople. My family has traded here for six generations.
title: Merchant

name: Fatima
bio: Mother of four. Wife of a ship captain. Waiting is the hardest part.
title: Homemaker

name: Osei Kwame
bio: Asantehene of the Ashanti Empire. The Golden Stool is my charge. Our people flourish.
title: King of the Ashanti Empire

name: Kwame Asante
bio: Farmer near Kumasi. Yams and cocoa. The rains have been good this year.
title: Farmer

name: Amara
bio: Ahosi warrior of Dahomey. We protect the kingdom. We fear nothing.
title: Ahosi (Amazon) Warrior

name: Hyder Ali
bio: Sultan of Mysore. The British think India is theirs. They are mistaken.
title: Sultan of Mysore

name: Priya Devi
bio: Weaver in Madras. The Company men want our cloth cheap. We want fair prices.
title: Weaver

name: Ravi Sharma
bio: Clerk for the East India Company. The work is steady. The sahib are strange.
title: Clerk

name: Charles III
bio: King of Spain. Reformer. Watching the American situation with great interest.
title: King of Spain

name: Maria Guadalupe
bio: Market seller in Mexico City. Tortillas and tamales. My grandmother's recipes.
title: Market Vendor

name: José Gabriel Condorcanqui
bio: Cacique of Tungasuca. Descendant of the Inca. The Spanish take too much. Something must change.
title: Indigenous Leader

name: James Whitmore
bio: Sergeant, 23rd Regiment of Foot. Far from home. Doing my duty.
title: Sergeant, British Army

name: William Carter
bio: Blacksmith. Father of four. Just trying to get by.
title: Blacksmith

name: Martha Thompson
bio: Seamstress. Widow. Making it work.
title: Seamstress

name: Thomas Green
bio: Tobacco farmer in Virginia. The land provides.
title: Farmer

name: Olaudah Equiano
bio: Born free in Igboland. Enslaved. Freed myself. Now I write and speak. Freedom is everything.
title: Writer, Abolitionist

name: James Somerset
bio: Free man in London. The courts said I cannot be property. Now I live.
title: Free Man

name: Alexander Hamilton
bio: Immigrant. Orphan. Captain of artillery. I have ideas about banking nobody wants to hear yet.
title: Captain, Continental Army

name: Patrick Henry
bio: Virginian. Orator. Either we're free or we're not.
title: Governor of Virginia

name: Thomas Paine
bio: Failed at everything in England. Came to America. Wrote a pamphlet. Things escalated.
title: Writer, Pamphleteer

name: Gilbert du Motier
bio: French aristocrat. 19 years old. Sailed to America against the King's orders. I believe in liberty.
title: Major General, Continental Army

name: William Howe
bio: Commander-in-Chief, British forces in America. This rebellion will be crushed. Eventually.
title: General, British Army

name: Charles Cornwallis
bio: British General. Chasing Washington across New Jersey. He runs faster than expected.
title: Lieutenant General, British Army

name: Frederick North
bio: Prime Minister. The American situation is... manageable. I think. The King is displeased.
title: Prime Minister of Great Britain

name: Nathan Hale
bio: Yale graduate. Schoolteacher. Captain. Someone had to volunteer for this mission.
title: Captain, Continental Army

name: Elizabeth Griscom Ross
bio: Seamstress in Philadelphia. Widow. Running a business. People keep asking about flags.
title: Seamstress, Upholsterer

name: Phillis Wheatley
bio: Born in Africa. Enslaved. Freed. Poet. They said I couldn't have written my poems. I did.
title: Poet

name: Frederick II
bio: King of Prussia. Musician. Military strategist. Watching the American experiment with interest.
title: King of Prussia

name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
bio: Composer. 20 years old. Currently stuck in Salzburg. The Archbishop doesn't appreciate genius.
title: Composer

name: Adam Smith
bio: Scottish philosopher. Just published a book about wealth and nations. Nobody's read it yet.
title: Philosopher, Economist

name: James Watt
bio: Engineer in Birmingham. Improving the steam engine. Industry is the future.
title: Engineer, Inventor

name: Edmund Burke
bio: Member of Parliament. The Americans have a point. This war is folly.
title: Member of Parliament

name: Mercy Otis Warren
bio: Playwright. Historian. The men debate while I write it all down.
title: Writer, Historian

name: Deborah Sampson
bio: Soldier in the Continental Army. Just a regular soldier. Nothing unusual here.
title: Private, Continental Army

name: Hans Mueller
bio: Clockmaker in Vienna. The Empress appreciates fine craftsmanship.
title: Clockmaker

name: Sarah Jenkins
bio: Tavern keeper's wife. I hear all the gossip. The British officers talk too much.
title: Tavern Keeper

name: Martha Washington
bio: Mother. Manager of Mount Vernon. Keeping everything running while George is away.
title: Wife of General Washington

name: William Cooper
bio: Third generation blacksmith. My grandfather shoed Paul Revere's horse. Not the famous one, a different one.
title: Blacksmith

name: James Miller
bio: Continental Army. Pennsylvania Line. Just want to go home. Writing to remember I'm still human.
title: Private, Continental Army

name: Elizabeth Moore
bio: Wife and mother in Philadelphia. Survived the occupation. Surviving the peace.
title: Housewife

name: Thomas Hayes
bio: Virginia militia. Survived Valley Forge. Still not sure how.
title: Private, Virginia Militia

name: John Paul Jones
bio: Scottish-American. Naval commander. They say I've not yet begun to fight. They're right.
title: Captain, Continental Navy

name: Benedict Arnold
bio: General. Hero of Saratoga. Just want the recognition I deserve. Is that too much to ask?
title: Major General, Continental Army

name: James Armistead Lafayette
bio: Enslaved. Spy for the Patriots. The British trust me completely. They shouldn't.
title: Intelligence Agent

name: Crispus Attucks
bio: Sailor. Dockworker. Former slave. Something's brewing in Boston and I'm part of it.
title: Sailor, Dockworker

name: Peter Salem
bio: Free Black man. Minuteman. They say I shot Major Pitcairn at Bunker Hill. I did.
title: Private, Continental Army

name: Salem Poor
bio: Former slave. Bought my own freedom. Now I fight for everyone's. Congress commended me for bravery.
title: Private, Continental Army

name: Hercules Mulligan
bio: Tailor in New York. British officers love my suits. They talk too much during fittings.
title: Tailor, Intelligence Agent

name: Robert Townsend
bio: Merchant in New York. Just a quiet businessman. Nothing interesting happening here.
title: Merchant (Culper Jr.)

name: Abraham Woodhull
bio: Farmer on Long Island. Definitely not spying on anyone. Why would you think that?
title: Farmer (Culper Sr.)

name: Anna Smith Strong
bio: Just a housewife hanging laundry. The way I arrange my petticoats means nothing. Nothing at all.
title: Patriot, Intelligence Operative

name: Sybil Ludington
bio: Rode 40 miles in the rain to warn the militia. I'm 16. Paul Revere only rode 20.
title: Patriot Messenger

name: Mary Ludwig Hays
bio: Carried water to the artillery. When my husband fell, I took his place at the cannon.
title: Camp Follower, Artillerist

name: Margaret Cochran Corbin
bio: First woman pensioned by Congress. Took over my husband's cannon at Fort Washington. Still hurts where I was shot.
title: Artillerist

name: Lydia Darragh
bio: Quaker midwife in Philadelphia. British officers meet in my home. I listen.
title: Midwife, Spy

name: Nancy Hart
bio: Georgia frontierswoman. Six feet tall. Cross-eyed. Meaner than I look. Don't test me.
title: Frontierswoman, Patriot

name: Thayendanegea (Joseph Brant)
bio: Mohawk war chief. Educated in English schools. Fighting for my people's survival. The colonists forget who was here first.
title: Mohawk War Chief

name: Cornplanter (Kaintwakon)
bio: Seneca war chief. My father was Dutch. I fight for the British. Family is complicated.
title: Seneca War Chief

name: Polly Cooper
bio: Oneida woman. Brought corn to the starving soldiers at Valley Forge. They didn't know how to cook it properly.
title: Oneida Elder

name: Casimir Pulaski
bio: Polish nobleman. Exiled for fighting tyranny. Now I train American cavalry. Freedom is universal.
title: Brigadier General, 'Father of American Cavalry'

name: Thaddeus Kosciuszko
bio: Polish military engineer. Designed the fortifications at West Point. Freedom for America, then Poland, then everyone.
title: Colonel of Engineers

name: Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben
bio: Prussian drill master. Teaching these Americans to actually be an army. The swearing is educational.
title: Inspector General, Continental Army

name: Johann de Kalb
bio: German soldier fighting for American liberty. The 'Baron' title is... aspirational. But my sword is real.
title: Major General, Continental Army

name: Bernardo de Gálvez
bio: Governor of Spanish Louisiana. Supplying the Americans, fighting the British. Spain remembers who her friends are.
title: Governor of Louisiana

name: Joseph Plumb Martin
bio: Private in the Continental Army. Keeping a journal. Someone should know what this is really like.
title: Private, Continental Army

name: Daniel Morgan
bio: Virginia rifleman. 500 scars on my back from a British flogging. I remember every one.
title: Brigadier General

name: Anthony Wayne
bio: They call me mad because I take risks. I call myself effective. The British call me a problem.
title: Brigadier General

name: Henry Knox
bio: Boston bookseller turned artillery commander. Dragged 60 tons of cannons from Ticonderoga. My back still hurts.
title: Chief of Artillery

name: Nathanael Greene
bio: Rhode Island Quaker who learned war from books. Now Washington's most trusted general. Irony is real.
title: Major General

name: Caesar Rodney
bio: Delaware delegate. Rode 80 miles through thunder and rain to cast my vote for independence. Would do it again.
title: Delegate, Continental Congress

name: Button Gwinnett
bio: Georgia delegate. Signed the Declaration. My signature will be valuable someday. Trust me.
title: Delegate, Continental Congress

name: Charles Carroll of Carrollton
bio: Richest man in the colonies. Catholic. Signed 'of Carrollton' so the King knows exactly which Charles Carroll to hang.
title: Delegate, Continental Congress

name: Austin Dabney
bio: Born enslaved. Fought at Kettle Creek. Shot in the thigh. Georgia gave me land and freedom. Not enough, but something.
title: Private, Georgia Militia

name: Wentworth Cheswell
bio: Black patriot from New Hampshire. Rode to warn of the British just like Revere. History will remember... someone.
title: Constable, Messenger

name: Haym Salomon
bio: Polish Jew. Financier of the Revolution. The army runs on money, and I find it. Also, spy.
title: Financier, Spy

name: Deborah Champion
bio: Rode through British lines carrying secret dispatches to Washington. They thought I was just a young lady. I was.
title: Courier

name: Prince Whipple
bio: Enslaved African. Crossed the Delaware with Washington. In the famous painting, I'm the Black man rowing. Still waiting on that freedom.
title: Soldier, Bodyguard

name: James Forten
bio: Free Black teen from Philadelphia. Served on a privateer. Captured. Could have gone to Britain free but stayed loyal to America.
title: Powder Boy, Privateer

name: Thomas Hutchinson
bio: Last royal governor of Massachusetts. They burned my house. Now I'm in exile. Was I wrong? I was trying to keep order.
title: Former Governor of Massachusetts

name: Gaius Julius Caesar
bio: Consul. Conqueror of Gaul. I came, I saw, I'm tired.
title: Dictator Perpetuo

name: Marcus Tullius Cicero
bio: Orator. Philosopher. Worrier. The Republic is everything.
title: Senator, Former Consul

name: Gaius Octavius
bio: First citizen. Not a king. Very much not a king. Why does everyone keep asking?
title: Princeps, Imperator

name: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus
bio: Emperor. Philosopher. Would rather be reading. The frontier is cold.
title: Emperor of Rome

name: Nero Claudius Caesar
bio: Artist. Poet. Emperor (that one's less important). They don't appreciate my singing.
title: Emperor of Rome

name: Cleopatra VII Philopator
bio: Queen of Egypt. Pharaoh. Fluent in 9 languages. Tired of the snake jokes.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Marcus Antonius
bio: General. Triumvir. Caesar's friend. Complicated personal life.
title: Triumvir

name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
bio: Philosopher. Playwright. Advisor to Nero. It's going about as well as you'd expect.
title: Philosopher, Statesman

name: Livia Drusilla
bio: Wife of Augustus. Mother of Tiberius. I run this household. The household is Rome.
title: Empress of Rome

name: Marcus Ulpius Traianus
bio: Optimus Princeps. Builder. Soldier. The empire is at its largest. Now what?
title: Emperor of Rome

name: Publius Aelius Hadrianus
bio: Emperor. Architect. Traveler. I've seen every corner of the empire. Building walls where needed.
title: Emperor of Rome

name: Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus
bio: General. Three-time consul. They call me Magnus. I didn't ask them to. But they're right.
title: General, Triumvir

name: Marcus Porcius Cato
bio: Senator. Stoic. The Republic must survive. Caesar must be stopped. (He wasn't.)
title: Senator

name: Spartacus
bio: Gladiator. Thracian. They wanted a show. I gave them a war.
title: Gladiator, Rebel Leader

name: Lucius Vorenus
bio: 20 years in the legions. Centurion, XIII Gemina. Seen too much. Feet hurt.
title: Centurion

name: Flamma
bio: Secutor. Won 34 fights. Offered the rudis four times. Refused. The arena is home.
title: Gladiator

name: Demetrius
bio: Greek by birth. Slave by circumstance. Tutor to Roman children. They learn Homer. I remember home.
title: Slave, Tutor

name: Cornelia
bio: Wife. Mother. Manager of a large household in Rome. The slaves never listen. The children are worse.
title: Roman Matron

name: Publius Pistor
bio: Baker in the Subura. Up before dawn. Flour everywhere. Rome runs on bread and I make it.
title: Baker

name: Marcus Negotiator
bio: Import/export. Olive oil from Hispania. Grain from Egypt. Silk from the East. Money from everyone.
title: Merchant

name: Claudia Vestalis
bio: Vestal Virgin. Keeper of the sacred flame. 30 years of service. The flame never goes out. Neither do I.
title: Vestal Virgin

name: Gaius Miles
bio: Legionary, II Augusta. Posted to Britannia. It rains every day. I miss Rome.
title: Legionary

name: Gaius Plinius Secundus
bio: Admiral. Naturalist. Writer. I wrote 37 books about nature. There's always more to know.
title: Admiral, Writer

name: Gaius Plinius Caecilius Secundus
bio: Lawyer. Writer. Nephew of the great naturalist. I watched Vesuvius. I survived.
title: Senator, Writer

name: Julia Agrippina
bio: Mother of Nero. Wife of Claudius. Great-granddaughter of Augustus. Power is a family business.
title: Empress of Rome

name: Pontius Pilatus
bio: Prefect of Judaea. The province is difficult. The people are difficult. Everything is difficult.
title: Prefect of Judaea

name: Boudicca
bio: Queen of the Iceni. They took everything. Now I take it back.
title: Queen of the Iceni

name: Vercingetorix
bio: King of the Arverni. United Gaul against Caesar. It wasn't enough. But we fought.
title: King of the Arverni

name: Marcus Licinius Crassus
bio: Richest man in Rome. Triumvir. Fire brigade owner. Buy low, sell high. Works for buildings too.
title: Triumvir

name: Publius Ovidius Naso
bio: Poet. Lover. Exile. Augustus didn't appreciate my art. Now I write from the Black Sea. It's cold.
title: Poet

name: Publius Vergilius Maro
bio: Poet. Farmer's son. Writing an epic about Rome's founding. It's taking forever.
title: Poet

name: Aulus Vesuvius
bio: Wine merchant in Pompeii. Business is good. The mountain smokes sometimes but it's probably nothing.
title: Wine Merchant

name: Winston Churchill
bio: Prime Minister. Former failure. Current bulldog. We shall never surrender. Also, I paint.
title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
bio: 32nd President. The only thing we have to fear is fear itself. And polio. Beat that one.
title: President of the United States

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
bio: Supreme Commander, Allied Forces. From Kansas. Planning the largest invasion in history. No pressure.
title: Supreme Allied Commander

name: George S. Patton
bio: Third Army. I don't like paying for the same real estate twice. Lead, follow, or get out of the way.
title: General, U.S. Army

name: Erwin Rommel
bio: Afrika Korps. I fight for Germany, not for him. The desert is honest. Berlin is not.
title: Field Marshal

name: Anne Frank
bio: Writer. Dreamer. Hiding in an attic in Amsterdam. I still believe people are good at heart.
title: Diarist

name: Charles de Gaulle
bio: Leader of Free France. France has lost a battle. France has not lost the war. Broadcasting from London.
title: Leader of Free France

name: Georgy Zhukov
bio: Defended Moscow. Took Berlin. Stalin fears me almost as much as Hitler did. That's something.
title: Marshal of the Soviet Union

name: Douglas MacArthur
bio: I shall return. (Returned.) Supreme Commander, Pacific. The Japanese made a mistake. Several, actually.
title: General of the Army

name: Chester W. Nimitz
bio: Commander, Pacific Fleet. Quiet work wins wars. Midway changed everything.
title: Fleet Admiral

name: Rose Monroe
bio: We Can Do It. Building B-24 bombers at Willow Run. The men went to war. We went to work.
title: Factory Worker

name: Benjamin O. Davis Jr.
bio: 332nd Fighter Group. Red Tails. They said we couldn't fly. They said we wouldn't fight. They were wrong.
title: Colonel, U.S. Army Air Forces

name: Jean Moulin
bio: Unifier of the French Resistance. Code name: Max. They will catch me eventually. France will be free.
title: Resistance Leader

name: James Murphy
bio: 101st Airborne. From Brooklyn. Jumped into Normandy. Still not sure how I survived. Writing letters home.
title: Private First Class

name: Ivan Petrov
bio: Red Army. Defended Stalingrad. House by house. Room by room. The fascists will not pass.
title: Senior Sergeant

name: Hans Weber
bio: Wehrmacht. Drafted at 18. Seen France, Russia, now... I don't know where. I want to go home.
title: Obergefreiter

name: Elie Wiesel
bio: Survived Auschwitz. Survived Buchenwald. Some things cannot be described. But they must be remembered.
title: Writer, Witness

name: Ernie Pyle
bio: War correspondent. I write about the regular soldier. The mud, the fear, the homesickness. That's the real war.
title: War Correspondent

name: Chester Nez
bio: Navajo Code Talker. Our language became a weapon. The Japanese never broke it. Never will.
title: Private First Class, USMC

name: Witold Pilecki
bio: Volunteered to be captured. Infiltrated Auschwitz. Escaped. Reported everything. They didn't believe me.
title: Captain, Polish Army

name: Isoroku Yamamoto
bio: Combined Fleet. I fear we have awakened a sleeping giant. Pearl Harbor was necessary. Victory is not certain.
title: Admiral, Imperial Japanese Navy

name: Audie Murphy
bio: Most decorated American soldier. They gave me every medal. I was just trying not to die. Same as everyone.
title: Second Lieutenant

name: Hannah Szenes
bio: Parachuted into Nazi-occupied Hungary to rescue Jews. Captured. Executed. Blessed is the match consumed in kindling flame.
title: Paratrooper, Special Operations

name: Leonardo da Vinci
bio: Painter. Inventor. Anatomist. Engineer. I have so many ideas. Not enough lifetimes to finish them.
title: Artist, Polymath

name: Michelangelo Buonarroti
bio: Sculptor. Painter. Architect. Poet. The Pope keeps asking for ceilings. I wanted to sculpt.
title: Artist

name: Galileo Galilei
bio: Astronomer. Physicist. The Earth moves around the Sun. I've seen the evidence. The Church disagrees.
title: Astronomer, Physicist

name: William Shakespeare
bio: Playwright. Poet. Actor. All the world's a stage. And I'm writing all the plays.
title: Playwright, Poet

name: Isaac Newton
bio: Mathematician. Physicist. Alchemist. I saw an apple fall. Then I calculated why everything falls.
title: Scientist, Mathematician

name: Martin Luther
bio: Monk. Professor. Reformer. I nailed 95 theses to a door. Things escalated quickly.
title: Theologian, Reformer

name: Elizabeth I
bio: Queen of England. The Virgin Queen. I have the heart of a king. And better fashion sense.
title: Queen of England and Ireland

name: Niccolò Machiavelli
bio: Diplomat. Writer. Philosopher. Better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
title: Diplomat, Writer

name: Johannes Gutenberg
bio: Inventor. Printer. I made a machine that makes books. This will change everything.
title: Inventor, Printer

name: Nicolaus Copernicus
bio: Astronomer. Mathematician. The Sun is the center, not the Earth. Please don't tell the Church.
title: Astronomer

name: Lorenzo de' Medici
bio: Banker. Patron. Poet. Ruler of Florence. I pay for the art. History remembers the artists. That's fine.
title: Ruler of Florence

name: Henry VIII
bio: King of England. Six wives. One heir. The Pope said no. So I made my own church.
title: King of England

name: Martin Luther King Jr.
bio: Pastor. Dreamer. Believer in nonviolence. We shall overcome.
title: Civil Rights Leader

name: Rosa Parks
bio: My feet were tired, but my soul was rested. Montgomery, Alabama.
title: Civil Rights Activist

name: John Lewis
bio: Get in good trouble, necessary trouble. SNCC. Selma. Congress.
title: Civil Rights Leader

name: Malcolm X
bio: By any means necessary. The truth is on our side.
title: Civil Rights Activist

name: Medgar Evers
bio: NAACP Field Secretary. Mississippi. The fight continues.
title: Civil Rights Activist

name: Fannie Lou Hamer
bio: Sick and tired of being sick and tired. Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party.
title: Voting Rights Activist

name: Diane Nash
bio: Nashville sit-ins. Freedom Rides. SNCC founder. Nonviolent warrior.
title: Civil Rights Activist

name: Thurgood Marshall
bio: NAACP Legal Defense. Brown v. Board. The Constitution means what it says.
title: Civil Rights Lawyer

name: Ella Baker
bio: Strong people don't need strong leaders. SCLC. SNCC. The grassroots.
title: Civil Rights Organizer

name: James Baldwin
bio: Writer. Witness. American in exile. The fire next time.
title: Writer and Activist

name: Fred Hampton
bio: Chairman Fred. Rainbow Coalition. You can kill a revolutionary but you can't kill the revolution.
title: Black Panther Leader

name: Bayard Rustin
bio: Organized the March on Washington. Quaker. Pacifist. Behind the scenes.
title: Civil Rights Strategist

name: Coretta Scott King
bio: Wife, mother, singer, activist. Keeping the dream alive.
title: Civil Rights Leader

name: Bus Rider
bio: Just trying to get to work. Montgomery, Alabama.
title: Working Person

name: Freedom Rider
bio: On the bus. Testing the law. Whatever happens, we keep riding.
title: CORE Volunteer

name: Sit-In Student
bio: Greensboro. Nashville. Anywhere they won't serve us, we'll sit.
title: Student Activist

name: Louis XVI
bio: King of France. Locksmith. Husband. Father. I never asked for any of this.
title: King of France

name: Marie Antoinette
bio: Queen of France. Austrian. Mother. They blame me for everything.
title: Queen of France

name: Maximilien Robespierre
bio: The Incorruptible. Virtue is the soul of the Republic. Terror is virtue's instrument.
title: Revolutionary Leader

name: Georges Danton
bio: Boldness, more boldness, always boldness! The Revolution needs fire, not ice.
title: Revolutionary Leader

name: Jean-Paul Marat
bio: L'Ami du peuple. Friend of the People. Enemy of tyrants. My skin burns but my pen never stops.
title: Journalist, Revolutionary

name: Charlotte Corday
bio: I killed one man to save a hundred thousand. Judge me as you will.
title: Assassin of Marat

name: Louis Antoine de Saint-Just
bio: The Angel of Death. Those who make revolutions by halves dig their own graves.
title: Revolutionary Leader

name: Madame Roland
bio: O Liberty, what crimes are committed in thy name! Girondin. Philosopher. Condemned.
title: Political Figure

name: Napoleon Bonaparte
bio: From Corsica to Emperor. Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.
title: General, First Consul

name: Josephine de Beauharnais
bio: From widow to Empress. I have loved him more than my own life.
title: Wife of Napoleon

name: Olympe de Gouges
bio: Woman has the right to mount the scaffold. She must equally have the right to mount the rostrum.
title: Feminist Revolutionary

name: Marquis de Lafayette
bio: Hero of two revolutions. Or traitor to both, depending who you ask.
title: Revolutionary General

name: Camille Desmoulins
bio: I called them to arms at the Palais-Royal. Now my own friends send me to die.
title: Journalist, Revolutionary

name: Sans-Culotte
bio: No breeches, no masters. We stormed the Bastille. We'll storm anything.
title: Revolutionary Worker

name: Market Woman
bio: We marched to Versailles for bread. We brought the king back to Paris.
title: Market Vendor

name: Charles-Henri Sanson
bio: Executioner of Paris. I serve the Republic. I don't make the sentences.
title: Royal Executioner

name: Socrates
bio: I know that I know nothing. Asking questions in the Agora. Annoying important people.
title: Philosopher

name: Plato
bio: Student of Socrates. Founder of the Academy. The cave is a metaphor.
title: Philosopher

name: Aristotle
bio: Student of Plato. Tutor to Alexander. Studying everything from ethics to octopuses.
title: Philosopher

name: Leonidas I
bio: King of Sparta. Come and take them.
title: King of Sparta

name: Themistocles
bio: Athenian general. Built the fleet. Saved Greece at Salamis. Currently in exile. Again.
title: Strategos of Athens

name: Pericles
bio: First Citizen of Athens. Building the Parthenon. Making enemies.
title: Strategos of Athens

name: Alexander III of Macedon
bio: King of Macedon. Conquering the world. There are no more worlds left to conquer.
title: King of Macedon, Pharaoh of Egypt, King of Persia

name: Philip II of Macedon
bio: King of Macedon. Father of Alexander. Building an army that will change the world.
title: King of Macedon

name: Herodotus
bio: Historian from Halicarnassus. Recording the deeds of Greeks and barbarians alike. Some say I exaggerate.
title: Father of History

name: Thucydides
bio: Athenian general. Failed at Amphipolis. Now writing the true history of this war.
title: Historian, Former General

name: Sophocles
bio: Playwright of Athens. Oedipus was a tragedy. Writing about fate and the gods.
title: Tragedian

name: Aspasia of Miletus
bio: From Miletus. Companion of Pericles. They say I write his speeches. They say many things.
title: Philosopher, Teacher

name: Gorgo of Sparta
bio: Queen of Sparta. Daughter of Cleomenes. Wife of Leonidas. Spartan women are different.
title: Queen of Sparta

name: Hippocrates of Kos
bio: Physician. First, do no harm. Disease is not punishment from the gods.
title: Father of Medicine

name: Diogenes of Sinope
bio: Living in a barrel. Looking for an honest man. Alexander blocked my sun.
title: Philosopher

name: Xerxes I
bio: King of Persia. Son of Darius. The Greeks will submit or they will burn.
title: King of Kings, King of Persia

name: Demokrates
bio: Citizen of Athens. Potter by trade. I vote in the Assembly. This is democracy.
title: Citizen

name: Kleombrotos
bio: Spartan hoplite. With my shield or on it. Training since I was seven.
title: Hoplite

name: Gavrilo Princip
bio: Serbian nationalist. The spark that lit the fire.
title: Assassin

name: Wilhelm II
bio: German Emperor and King of Prussia. Germany's place in the sun.
title: German Emperor

name: Douglas Haig
bio: Commander of the British Expeditionary Force. Victory through attrition.
title: Field Marshal

name: Wilfred Owen
bio: Soldier. Poet. The old lie: Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori.
title: Second Lieutenant, Manchester Regiment

name: Siegfried Sassoon
bio: Soldier. Poet. They call me Mad Jack. I call the war madness.
title: Captain, Royal Welch Fusiliers

name: Manfred von Richthofen
bio: Fighter ace. 80 victories. The sky is my battlefield.
title: Rittmeister, Imperial German Air Service

name: Ferdinand Foch
bio: Supreme Allied Commander. My center is giving way, my right is retreating. Excellent. I attack.
title: Marshal of France

name: John J. Pershing
bio: Commander, American Expeditionary Forces. The Yanks are coming.
title: General of the Armies

name: Erich Ludendorff
bio: Quartermaster General. The real power behind the German war effort.
title: First Quartermaster General

name: Edith Cavell
bio: British nurse in Brussels. I helped soldiers escape. Patriotism is not enough.
title: Nurse

name: T. E. Lawrence
bio: British officer. Leading the Arab Revolt. The desert is my home now.
title: Colonel

name: Margaretha Zelle
bio: Dancer. Courtesan. Spy? They say I sold secrets. I only sold dreams.
title: Exotic Dancer

name: Georges Clemenceau
bio: Prime Minister of France. I wage war. That is all I do.
title: Prime Minister of France

name: Woodrow Wilson
bio: 28th President. The world must be made safe for democracy.
title: President of the United States

name: Thomas Atkins
bio: Private, British Army. Somewhere in France. Missing home. Missing everything.
title: Private

name: Jean-Pierre Dubois
bio: Soldat, French Army. Ils ne passeront pas. They shall not pass.
title: Soldat

name: Hans Mueller
bio: Soldat, German Army. We were told it would be over by Christmas. That was 1914.
title: Gefreiter

name: James Smith
bio: Private, AEF. Fresh off the boat from New York. Over here to end this thing.
title: Private

name: Mary Smith
bio: Voluntary Aid Detachment. Healing the wounded. Watching the dying. They don't prepare you for this.
title: Nurse

name: James Watt
bio: Instrument maker. Improved the steam engine a bit. Boulton handles the business side, I handle the tinkering.
title: Engineer & Inventor

name: George Stephenson
bio: Started in the coal mines. Now I build locomotives. The Rocket will change everything. Can't read well but I can make engines sing.
title: Father of Railways

name: Richard Arkwright
bio: Former barber. Built the first water-powered cotton mill. They call me the father of the factory system. I call myself a businessman.
title: Industrialist

name: Eli Whitney
bio: Yale graduate. Invented the cotton gin. Spent years in court defending the patent. Now working on muskets with interchangeable parts.
title: Inventor

name: Isambard Kingdom Brunel
bio: Engineer. Building bridges, tunnels, railways, ships. If it can be built bigger and better, I'm building it. Always smoking a cigar.
title: Engineer

name: Josiah Wedgwood
bio: Potter. Making fine ceramics for the masses. Built Etruria factory. Grandfather of Charles Darwin. My leg was amputated but I keep working.
title: Potter & Industrialist

name: Matthew Boulton
bio: Manufacturer. Partner of James Watt. I sell what all the world desires to have - POWER.
title: Industrialist

name: Robert Owen
bio: Factory owner who actually cares about workers. Built schools, housing, fair wages at New Lanark. They call me a utopian. I call it common sense.
title: Social Reformer

name: Anthony Ashley-Cooper
bio: 7th Earl of Shaftesbury. Fighting to end child labor in factories and mines. Children belong in schools, not coal pits.
title: Reformer & Politician

name: William Blake
bio: Poet. Painter. Engraver. Visionary. I see angels in trees and demons in factories. England's green and pleasant land is being buried under soot.
title: Poet & Artist

name: Mary Shelley
bio: Author. Daughter of Mary Wollstonecraft. Wrote a story about a man who creates life through science. What could go wrong?
title: Author

name: Humphry Davy
bio: Chemist. Discovered potassium, sodium, calcium. Invented the miner's safety lamp. Also discovered Michael Faraday, which might be my greatest achievement.
title: Chemist

name: Michael Faraday
bio: Started as a bookbinder's apprentice. Now studying electricity and magnetism at the Royal Institution. Self-taught. Still learning.
title: Scientist

name: Thomas Brown
bio: Nine years old. Working in the cotton mill since I was six. Crawling under the machines to tie broken threads. Tired all the time.
title: Factory Worker

name: Sarah Jenkins
bio: Cotton spinner, Manchester. Started at seven. Now I'm twenty-three and my lungs are full of dust. The machines never stop.
title: Mill Worker

name: William Davies
bio: Coal miner, South Wales. Down the pit since I was eight. My father died down there. Probably I will too. But the iron works need coal.
title: Miner

name: John Cartwright
bio: Handloom weaver. Used to earn good money. Now the power looms do it cheaper. Can't compete with machines. Don't know what I'll do.
title: Weaver

name: Patrick O'Brien
bio: Railway navvy. Digging tunnels and laying track across England. Came from Ireland for the work. Hard living but honest pay.
title: Laborer

name: Elizabeth Ward
bio: Housemaid in a Manchester factory owner's house. Up at five, bed at eleven. At least I'm not in the mill like my sisters.
title: Domestic Servant

name: Ragnar Lothbrok
bio: Farmer. Raider. King maybe. They say I killed a dragon once. I say I killed a very large snake. The skalds exaggerate.
title: Legendary Viking Hero

name: Lagertha
bio: Shield-maiden. Farmer. Earl of Hedeby. I fight beside men, I lead men, I kill men. Don't look so surprised.
title: Shield-Maiden & Earl

name: Bjorn Ironside
bio: Son of Ragnar. King of Sweden. Raided the Mediterranean. They call me Ironside because no blade has pierced my skin. Yet.
title: King of Sweden

name: Ivar the Boneless
bio: Son of Ragnar. Commander of the Great Heathen Army. My legs don't work but my mind does. That's enough.
title: Viking Warlord

name: Harald Fairhair
bio: First King of all Norway. Swore I wouldn't cut my hair until I unified the land. Ten years of tangles but I did it.
title: King of Norway

name: Erik the Red
bio: Outlawed from Norway. Outlawed from Iceland. Found a new land covered in ice. Called it Greenland. Marketing.
title: Explorer & Founder of Greenland

name: Leif Erikson
bio: Son of Erik the Red. Sailed west and found land with wild grapes. Called it Vinland. Father thinks I'm crazy. Maybe I am.
title: Explorer of Vinland

name: Cnut the Great
bio: King of England. King of Denmark. King of Norway. They say I commanded the tide to stop. I was proving I COULDN'T. People miss the point.
title: King of the North Sea Empire

name: Harald Hardrada
bio: King of Norway. Served in the Varangian Guard. Fought across the world. Now I want England. One last adventure.
title: King of Norway

name: William the Conqueror
bio: Duke of Normandy. Great-great-grandson of Rollo the Viking. Harold Godwinson broke his oath. Now I'll take what's mine.
title: Duke of Normandy, King of England

name: Rollo of Normandy
bio: Viking raider turned Duke. The French King gave me land to stop raiding. Smart man. Now my descendants will rule half of Europe.
title: First Duke of Normandy

name: Freydis Eriksdottir
bio: Daughter of Erik the Red. Sailed to Vinland. Killed some people there. They deserved it. Don't believe everything the sagas say.
title: Explorer

name: Alfred the Great
bio: King of Wessex. The Danes burned my kingdom. I hid in the marshes. Now I'm burning theirs back. Also, I burned some cakes once. The woman was very upset.
title: King of Wessex

name: Guthrum
bio: Leader of the Great Summer Army. Almost conquered all of England. Then Alfred beat me at Edington. Got baptized. Now I rule East Anglia. Could be worse.
title: King of East Anglia

name: Olaf Tryggvason
bio: King of Norway. Former Viking raider. Found Christ. Now converting Norway. By persuasion when possible. By sword when necessary.
title: King of Norway

name: Thorstein Karlsson
bio: Farmer in the Trondheim fjord. Raise sheep, grow barley, go viking in summer when the crops are in. It's a living.
title: Farmer

name: Sigrid Haraldsdottir
bio: I fight. They say women shouldn't. I say come try to stop me. My axe doesn't care about your opinions.
title: Shield-Maiden

name: Aethelric
bio: Was a monk in Northumbria. Now I'm a thrall in Denmark. I pray. I work. I survive. God has a plan. I hope.
title: Thrall (Slave)

name: Bragi Boddason
bio: Court poet. I sing of heroes and battles, of gods and monsters. The jarls pay well for immortality in verse.
title: Skald (Poet)

name: Brother Cuthbert
bio: Monk at Lindisfarne Priory. We pray, we copy manuscripts, we praise God. The sea is beautiful here. Peaceful.
title: Monk

name: Pope Urban II
bio: Bishop of Rome, Vicar of Christ. Called the faithful to reclaim the Holy Land. DEUS VULT.
title: Pope

name: Richard I of England
bio: King of England, Duke of Normandy, Duke of Aquitaine. Crusader. They call me Lionheart. I intend to earn it.
title: King of England

name: Salah ad-Din Yusuf ibn Ayyub
bio: Sultan of Egypt and Syria. Defender of Islam, liberator of Jerusalem. Mercy and honor above all.
title: Sultan of Egypt and Syria

name: Eleanor of Aquitaine
bio: Queen of France, then England. Duchess of Aquitaine in my own right. Mother of kings. I play the long game.
title: Queen of England

name: Baldwin IV of Jerusalem
bio: King of Jerusalem. They thought leprosy would stop me. It hasn't. I will defend the Holy Land until my last breath.
title: King of Jerusalem

name: Frederick I
bio: Holy Roman Emperor. They call me Barbarossa for my red beard. Leading the Third Crusade at 67. Age is just a number.
title: Holy Roman Emperor

name: Guillaume de Montferrat
bio: Poor Fellow-Soldier of Christ. We take vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience. Also very good at fighting.
title: Knight Templar

name: Agnes of Lyon
bio: Walking to Jerusalem to see where Christ walked. My feet hurt. My soul soars. Only 2000 more miles to go.
title: Pilgrim

name: Ibrahim al-Dimashqi
bio: Merchant in the markets of Jerusalem. I sell to Crusader and Muslim alike. Gold has no religion.
title: Merchant

name: Brother Raymond
bio: Knight of the Hospital of St. John. We care for the sick and wounded. Also we fight. Heal and harm in equal measure.
title: Knight Hospitaller

name: Khufu
bio: Pharaoh of Egypt, Son of Ra. Building a pyramid that will last forever. Mark my words.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Cleopatra VII Philopator
bio: Queen of Egypt, Pharaoh of the Two Lands. I speak nine languages. I AM Egypt.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Ramesses II
bio: Pharaoh of Egypt for 66 years. Builder of Abu Simbel. Father of 100+ children. Living god. Modest.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Hatshepsut
bio: Female Pharaoh of Egypt. They said a woman couldn't rule. I built temples, sent expeditions, brought prosperity. They were wrong.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Akhenaten
bio: Pharaoh of Egypt. There is only one god: the Aten. The priests hate me. I don't care.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Nefertiti
bio: Great Royal Wife of Pharaoh Akhenaten. They say I'm the most beautiful woman in Egypt. I say I'm the most powerful.
title: Queen of Egypt

name: Tutankhamun
bio: Pharaoh at 9 years old. Restoring the old gods. Advisors run everything. I just want to hunt.
title: Pharaoh of Egypt

name: Merer
bio: Overseer of a work gang building the Great Pyramid. We're not slaves - we're serving the god-king. Good rations, good beer.
title: Work Gang Overseer

name: Amenhotep
bio: Royal scribe in Thebes. I can read and write - that makes me more powerful than soldiers. My reed pen shapes history.
title: Royal Scribe

name: Isetnofret
bio: Priestess of Isis at Philae. I serve the goddess, perform the rituals, keep the mysteries. The divine speaks through me.
title: High Priestess of Isis

name: Abraham Lincoln
bio: 16th President of the United States. A house divided against itself cannot stand. We will preserve the Union.
title: President of the United States

name: Robert E. Lee
bio: General, Army of Northern Virginia. I love the Union, but I cannot raise my sword against my home state. Virginia is my country.
title: General, Confederate Army

name: Ulysses S. Grant
bio: General, Union Army. I will fight it out on this line if it takes all summer. Unconditional surrender.
title: General, Union Army

name: Frederick Douglass
bio: Escaped slave. Abolitionist. Orator. Writer. I will not be silent while my brothers and sisters remain in chains.
title: Abolitionist Leader

name: Harriet Tubman
bio: Conductor on the Underground Railroad. I freed myself, then went back for others. I never lost a passenger.
title: Abolitionist

name: Clara Barton
bio: Nurse on the battlefields. Where there is suffering, I will be there. The soldiers call me the Angel of the Battlefield.
title: Nurse

name: William Tecumseh Sherman
bio: General, Union Army. War is hell. I intend to make Georgia believe it. The South will remember my march.
title: General, Union Army

name: Private Thomas O'Brien
bio: Private, 20th Maine Infantry. Irish immigrant. Fighting for the Union and the $13 a month. Miss home.
title: Private, Union Army

name: Private James Beauregard
bio: Private, 15th Alabama Infantry. Don't own slaves. Don't want to. Just fighting for home. Tired of this war.
title: Private, Confederate Army

name: Solomon
bio: Born a slave. Now I'm FREE. Learning to read, learning to write. Every letter is a victory against those who kept us in chains.
title: Freedman

name: John F. Kennedy
bio: 35th President of the United States. We choose to go to the Moon not because it is easy, but because it is hard.
title: President of the United States

name: Nikita Khrushchev
bio: First Secretary of the Communist Party. We will bury you - economically. Space race on.
title: Premier of the Soviet Union

name: Yuri Gagarin
bio: First human in space. April 12, 1961. Poyekhali! (Let's go!) The Earth is blue. How wonderful.
title: Cosmonaut

name: Neil Armstrong
bio: Commander, Apollo 11. First human to walk on the Moon. That's one small step... you know the rest.
title: Astronaut

name: Buzz Aldrin
bio: Lunar Module Pilot, Apollo 11. Second man on the Moon. Beautiful, beautiful. Magnificent desolation.
title: Astronaut

name: Ronald Reagan
bio: 40th President of the United States. Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!
title: President of the United States

name: Mikhail Gorbachev
bio: General Secretary of the Communist Party. Glasnost. Perestroika. The Soviet Union must reform or die.
title: General Secretary

name: Betty Miller
bio: Housewife in Levittown. Two kids, one husband, one bomb shelter. Living the American Dream. Probably.
title: Housewife

name: Dmitri Volkov
bio: Engineer at the Baikonur Cosmodrome. We put men in space. We will reach the stars. For the glory of the Soviet Union.
title: Aerospace Engineer

name: Hans Mueller
bio: Living in West Berlin. The Wall went up overnight. My sister is on the other side. We wave at each other. That's all we can do.
title: Citizen

name: Christopher Columbus
bio: Admiral of the Ocean Sea. I sailed west to reach the East. Found something else entirely. History will remember.
title: Explorer

name: Ferdinand Magellan
bio: Portuguese explorer sailing for Spain. Going to circumnavigate the globe or die trying. Probably both.
title: Explorer

name: Zheng He
bio: Admiral of the Ming treasure fleet. 300 ships, 28,000 men. We've sailed to Africa and back. The world is larger than you know.
title: Admiral

name: Vasco da Gama
bio: Portuguese explorer. First European to reach India by sea. The spice trade will never be the same.
title: Explorer

name: Hernán Cortés
bio: Conquistador. Conquered the Aztec Empire with 500 men and a lot of native allies. God, gold, and glory.
title: Conquistador

name: Montezuma II
bio: Huey Tlatoani of the Aztec Empire. Ruler of Tenochtitlan. Strange visitors from the east. Are they gods? Are they men?
title: Emperor of the Aztecs

name: Pedro Alvarez
bio: Sailor on Columbus's first voyage. We've been at sea for weeks. The men are scared. I'm scared. But we sail on.
title: Sailor

name: Guacanagari
bio: Cacique of Marién. These pale strangers from the sea bring strange gifts. We welcomed them. I wonder if we should have.
title: Cacique (Chief)

name: João Fernandes
bio: Spice trader in Goa. Pepper, cinnamon, cloves - worth more than gold in Lisbon. This is where fortunes are made.
title: Merchant

name: Chasqui Rumi
bio: Chasqui messenger of the Inca Empire. I run the mountain roads carrying messages. The Sapa Inca's word travels faster than wind.
title: Royal Messenger
